name: East Head and Ellanore Circular Walk, Sussex East

ai.summary: A 12.1 km circular coastal hike in Sussex East, UK, following the East Head dunes and the Ellanore coastline. The route is moderate in difficulty, with a mix of compact paths, sandy dune trails, and grassy tracks, offering sea views and varied scenery.
ai.terrain_summary: Mixed coastal terrain: firm paths, soft sand on the dunes, grassy field edges, and short boardwalks. Expect uneven sections, occasional mud after rain, and exposed stretches where wind can be strong.
ai.safety_notes: Plan ahead around tides and weather: check tide times and avoid the East Head spit at high tide; coastal sections can be exposed and slippery when windy. Wear sturdy waterproof boots and bring layered clothing for wind and rain. Carry water, snacks, and a map or GPS; ensure your phone is charged and you have a means of navigation. Stay on marked paths, watch for soft sand and dune edges, and avoid cliff or dune collapse areas. Mobile reception can be patchy; inform someone of your route and expected return time. Be mindful of wildlife and livestock on rural sections and respect the environment.
recommended_gear: Layered clothing and a waterproof/windproof jacket
Map, compass or GPS device (and a charged phone)
ai.best_seasons: Spring to autumn (roughly March–October) typically offers the mildest weather and best visibility for coastal views; the route is walkable year-round with appropriate clothing and tide awareness.

seo.title: East Head and Ellanore Circular Walk – 12.1 km Coastal Hike in Sussex East, UK
seo.meta_description: Discover the 12.1 km East Head and Ellanore Circular Walk in Sussex East, UK. A moderate coastal hike with dunes, beaches, and scenic sea views; practical safety tips and gear.
